_metadata.title: Health and Wellness Guide - Extracted Data
_metadata.description: Extracted patient data organized in the exact order of questions as they appear in the PDF

page_1_section_1_my_purpose._header: HEALTH AND WELLNESS GUIDE - Your path to a longer, healthier life

field_004_my_purpose.question: Why do I want to improve my health?
field_004_my_purpose.value: Me and my wife like to do hiking and enjoy outdoors and also I want to be healthy to be with my grandkids and kids.

_my_primary_health_goals._description: Based on your goals, lifestyle, and health assessment, we will prioritize three objectives to bring you closer to your purpose.

field_005_health_goal_1.question: Health Goal #1
field_005_health_goal_1.value: Improve liver health by reducing inflammation and  normalizing liver enzymes. to protect the liver, improves metabolism, reduces  cardiovascular risk, and restores whole-body health.

field_006_health_goal_1_importance.question: Why is Health Goal #1 important?
field_006_health_goal_1_importance.value: to protect the liver, improves metabolism, reduces  cardiovascular risk, and restores whole-body health.

field_007_health_goal_2.question: Health Goal #2
field_007_health_goal_2.value: Improve Insulin Sensitivity and Metabolic Flexibility

field_008_health_goal_2_importance.question: Why is Health Goal #2 important?
field_008_health_goal_2_importance.value: to prevent progression to type 2 diabetes

field_009_health_goal_3.question: Health Goal #3
field_009_health_goal_3.value: Improve lipid balance and reduce long-term

field_011_summary.question: 2.1. SUMMARY:
field_011_summary.value:
Richard shows:
Normal findings in:
CBC
Renal function
Thyroid
PSA
Electrolytes
Glucose metabolism
Urinalysis & stool exam
Lp(a) (excellent)
Inflammatory markers only mildly elevated
-Abnormal findings centered around:
NAFLD grade II → Elevated AST/ALT, ferritin, low HDL, elevated LDL, mild insulin resistance
Vitamin D excess → 81.8 ng/mL
ApoB slightly elevated
hs-CRP mildly elevated
-Cardiovascular risk remains LOW because:
CAC score = 15
Lp(a) extremely low
ApoB moderate
HDL low due to fatty liver, not arterial disease
High muscularity and high physical activity

field_012_functional_medicine_approach.question: 2.2. FUNCTIONAL MEDICINE APPROACH: MODIFIABLE LIFESTYLES AND DYSFUNCTIONS
field_012_functional_medicine_approach.value:
Reverse NAFLD (primary goal)
Improve liver detox phases, mitochondrial fat oxidation, hepatic glucose handling.
Improve hepatic insulin sensitivity
Adjust macronutrient timing; increase fiber and plants; adjust fructose load.
Lower inflammation
Through nutrition, circadian alignment, and omega-3.
Support mitochondrial function
Maintain exercise, optimize micronutrients (magnesium, B-complex).
Normalize Vitamin D
Reduce dose.
Improve evening metabolic activity
Introduce low-intensity movement after 3–4 pm.
Dermatologic follow-up
Actinic keratosis & ulcerated lesion require evaluation.

page_3_vital_signs._header: 2.3. VITAL SIGNS AND BODY COMPOSITION ANALYSIS (INBODY)

field_014_bmi_interpretation.question: BODY MASS INDEX (BMI) - INTERPRETATION/OBSERVATION
field_014_bmi_interpretation.value: misleading in individuals with high muscle mass.

field_026_abdominal_circumference_interp.question: ABDOMINAL CIRCUMFERENCE - INTERPRETATION/OBSERVATION
field_026_abdominal_circumference_interp.value: out of range, normal less than 101

field_034_inbody_interpretation.question: INBODY - INTERPRETATION/OBSERVATION
field_034_inbody_interpretation.value: a 65- year-old man, 188 cm tall and weighing  109.9 kg, with an exceptionally strong  and well-preserved body composition  for his age. His skeletal muscle mass is  49.7 kg, which is well above average  and places him in a category of  excellent muscularity. His fat-free mass  (87.3 kg) and total body water (64.1 L)  are also high, reflecting strong muscle  tissue quality. The whole-body  ECW/TBW ratio of 0.381 is normal,  indicating healthy fluid balance, and  the total phase angle of 6.5° is very  favorable for his age, showing good  cell integrity and metabolic function.  His BMI is 31.1, which is technically in  the obesity range by definition, but this  classification does not apply well to  muscular individuals. The body fat  percentage of 20.6% is normal for a fit  adult male and especially good for a 65 -year-old, aligning with his high InBody  score of 94 out of 100, which confirms  excellent overall condition. The visceral  fat area is 106.4 cm², which sits near  the upper end of normal but not in a  dangerous or extreme range— especially for a tall, muscular man.  Many athletic or well-trained older  adults fall within this band. His waist  circumference (102.8 cm) and waist– hip ratio (0.91) are slightly elevated,  but these values must be interpreted in  the context of his large frame and  muscle mass. Segmental analysis  shows strong, symmetrical muscle  across arms, legs, and trunk, with no  abnormalities. The metabolic rate  (2255 kcal) is high because of his  excellent muscle mass. Overall, the  report paints the picture of a very fit,  muscular, and healthy older adult with  excellent cellular integrity, strong  muscle mass, and only mild age- related central fat accumulation, which  is extremely common. Nothing  indicates a pathological fat level, and  the high InBody score validates his  great physical condition.

field_036_cardiopulmonary.question: Cardiopulmonary
field_036_cardiopulmonary.value: Regular rhythm, no audible murmurs. Lungs: Even breath sounds bilaterally, well ventilated.

field_037_neurological.question: Neurological
field_037_neurological.value: Alert and oriented; no neurological deficits.

field_039_eyes.question: Eyes
field_039_eyes.value: Pupils equal, round, and reactive to light; extraocular movements intact.

field_041_abdomen.question: Abdomen
field_041_abdomen.value: Soft and depressible; non-tender to palpation; no masses.

field_042_extremities.question: Extremities
field_042_extremities.value: Symmetrical; no signs of acute deep venous thrombosis; presence of  venous insufficiency changes with ochre dermatitis in the left lower limb;  distal pulses normal and symmetric; no pedal edema.

field_043_skin.question: Skin
field_043_skin.value: Normal coloration, adequate turgor. On the right temporal region, there is a  non-ulcerated actinic keratosis measuring approximately 1 × 1 cm. In the posterior crease of the left ear, there is a 5 mm ulcerated lesion.

Lp(a) extremely low + calcium score = low actual r

field_045_brain_cognitive_health.value: No specific findings - see hematologic system

field_047_vitamins_minerals.value: Vitamin D (25-OH)81.8 ng/mL30–74Elevated — excessive supplementation. Magnesium1.9 mg/dL1.8–2.6Normal-low

field_048_liver_detoxification.value: TestResultReferenceInterpretation AST56 U/L11–34Elevated ALT54 U/L0–45Elevated ALP74 U/L50–116Normal GGT39 U/L0–55Normal Interpretation AST and ALT mildly elevated → hepatocellular injury pattern, consistent  with NAFLD grade II and possibly intense exercise. No cholestasis (normal  ALP + GGT).

field_049_hormonal_endocrine.value: TSH2.40 uIU/mL0.40–4.00Normal thyroid function Testosterone total490.9 ng/dL127–1020Excellent level for age Vitamin D (25-OH)81.8 ng/mL30–74Elevated — excessive  supplementation Fasting insulin14.4 µIU/mL2–17High-normal → mild insulin resistance  (hepatic) Interpretation Normal thyroid and excellent testosterone level. Vitamin D is above optimal  range. Insulin indicates early insulin resistance, compatible with NAFLD.

field_051_ascvd_risk.value: LOW - CAC score = 15, Lp(a) extremely low

field_053_others_labs.question: Others
field_053_others_labs.value: Hematologic System: Hemoglobin17.0 g/dL14.3–17.0High-normal; Hematocrit46.7%42–53Normal; RBC count5.75 ×10⁶/µL3.7–5.5Slightly elevated. field_054_additional_lab_parameters.question: Additional parameters
field_054_additional_lab_parameters.value: Electrolytes: Sodium139 mmol/L Normal, Potassium4.2 mmol/L Normal, Chloride106 mmol/L Normal, Calcium9.1 mg/dL Normal. Metabolic Panel: Fasting glucose92 mg/dL Normal, HbA1c5.1% Excellent, Fasting insulin14.4 High-normal

field_055_ekg.question: EKG:
field_055_ekg.value: (Normal Study) Rhythm & Rate Normal sinus rhythm, with upright P waves in leads I, II, and aVF. Rate appears within normal limits (~60–70 bpm). Consistent P before every QRS and constant PR interval → normal AV conduction. Intervals PR interval: normal. QRS duration: narrow → no bundle branch block. QT interval: appears normal for heart rate. Axis Normal frontal plane axis; no deviation. QRS Complex No pathological Q waves. No signs of ventricular hypertrophy. Good R-wave progression across precordial leads (V1–V6). ST Segment & T Waves ST segments are isoelectric, without elevation or depression → no evidence of ischemia or infarction. T waves are normal in morphology and distribution; no inversion or strain pattern. Other Findings No ectopy (no PACs, PVCs). No signs of pericarditis, electrolyte imbalance, or arrhythmogenic patterns. Overall Impression Normal ECG. No evidence of prior myocardial infarction, ischemia, arrhythmia, conduction abnormalities, or structural heart disease.

field_056_images.question: Images:
field_056_images.value: Abdominal ultrasound: The abdominal ultrasound shows moderate hepatic steatosis (grade II) with a mildly enlarged and heterogeneous  liver, but no focal lesions, no signs of chronic liver disease, and no evidence of fibrosis or cirrhosis. The gallbladder is absent due to prior surgery, and the biliary ducts are normal. The pancreas shows moderate fatty infiltration (lipomatosis), a common age-related finding, with no masses or  inflammatory changes. The spleen and kidneys are normal, except for a small simple renal cyst (10 mm) on the right kidney, which is benign  and requires no intervention. The aorta, retroperitoneum, and urinary bladder are normal. The prostate is small and within normal size for his age (17.5 cc). No free fluid, masses, or bowel abnormalities are seen. Impression Moderate hepatic steatosis (grade II). Moderate pancreatic lipomatosis. Benign simple renal cyst (right kidney). Otherwise normal abdominal ultrasound. Coronary Calcium Score: CAC score = 15, 31st percentile, LOW risk.

page_10_11_section_3_health_goals._description: Based on your personal goals, lifestyle, and health assessment, we will set three key objectives that will allow us to make significant progress toward your purpose.

field_058_goal1_key_result_1.question: Goal #1 - KEY RESULT 1
field_058_goal1_key_result_1.value: Improve liver health by reducing inflammation and normalizing liver enzymes.

field_059_goal1_key_action_1_1.question: Goal #1 - KEY ACTION 1.1
field_059_goal1_key_action_1_1.value: Implement a liver-focused, anti-inflammatory diet: Reduce fructose, increase vegetables to 6-7 servings/day, avoid refined sugars.

field_060_goal1_key_action_1_2.question: Goal #1 - KEY ACTION 1.2
field_060_goal1_key_action_1_2.value: Add afternoon metabolic movement: 10-15 minutes of light walking after lunch and dinner.

field_061_goal1_key_action_1_3.question: Goal #1 - KEY ACTION 1.3
field_061_goal1_key_action_1_3.value: Support liver detoxification pathways with adequate hydration and phytonutrients.

field_062_goal1_key_result_2.question: Goal #1 - KEY RESULT 2
field_062_goal1_key_result_2.value: Drink 1.5-2.0 liters of water daily, include liver-supportive foods.

field_064_goal2_title.question: Goal #2 Title/Description
field_064_goal2_title.value: Improve Insulin Sensitivity and Metabolic Flexibility

field_065_goal2_key_result_1.question: Goal #2 - KEY RESULT 1
field_065_goal2_key_result_1.value: Reduce hepatic insulin resistance and improve metabolic efficiency.

field_066_goal2_key_action_1_1.question: Goal #2 - KEY ACTION 1.1
field_066_goal2_key_action_1_1.value: Adjust fasting and feeding schedule: Add small protein-based afternoon snack.

field_067_goal2_key_action_1_2.question: Goal #2 - KEY ACTION 1.2
field_067_goal2_key_action_1_2.value: Increase daily fiber intake: 1-2 teaspoons of psyllium or ground flaxseed.

field_068_goal2_key_action_1_3.question: Goal #2 - KEY ACTION 1.3
field_068_goal2_key_action_1_3.value: Add low-intensity cardio sessions: 12-20 minutes of Zone 2-3 cardio 3 times per week.

_goal_3._footer: - Progress happens through small steps. You're already on your way! -

field_071_goal3_title.question: Goal #3 Title/Description
field_071_goal3_title.value: Optimize Cardiovascular Risk and Improve Lipid Profile

field_072_goal3_key_result_1.question: Goal #3 - KEY RESULT 1
field_072_goal3_key_result_1.value: Improve lipid balance and reduce long-term cardiovascular risk.

field_073_goal3_key_action_1_1.question: Goal #3 - KEY ACTION 1.1
field_073_goal3_key_action_1_1.value: Improve fat quality and increase natural omega-3 intake: Eat fatty fish 2-3 times per week.

field_074_goal3_key_action_1_2.question: Goal #3 - KEY ACTION 1.2
field_074_goal3_key_action_1_2.value: Reduce Vitamin D supplementation: Lower dose to 2,000-3,000 IU/day.

field_075_goal3_key_action_1_3.question: Goal #3 - KEY ACTION 1.3
field_075_goal3_key_action_1_3.value: Mandatory post-meal walking: 10-12 minutes of walking after the largest meal.
